name: Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites Yulee

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on a road trip, don't think I would stay again. The room was fine, also clean which of course is important. But after being on the road all day and exhausted we wanted a nice hot shower....well, there was no hot water. When we called the front desk they could care less. So needless to say we had cold showers, not very pleasant ,. Won't stay there again for this reason. .
reviews.title: Just Ok

reviews.text: We usually never have a problem with Holiday Inn Express but this was our first time at this particular one and won't stay again. But the water issue was the only problem. So if you don't mind the ice cold shower, then there is no problem.
reviews.title: Comfortable Beds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here one night using discount coupon without reservation. Front desk was very nice and our beds were very comfortable to sleep. We ate dinner at Murray's Grille, that was OK.
reviews.title: OK for an I-95 road trip

reviews.text: After nearly 8 hrs. on the road, we were glad to stop at the Holiday Inn Express right off I-95 in Yulee, Florida. I expected the hotel to be nicer. The room was adequate and clean; the bed was comfortable. The breakfast was disappointing. They need some healthy choices like fresh fruit.
reviews.title: Great Alternative to Staying on Amelia Island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family (sister, mother and grandmother) stayed here in November 2010. We were visiting nearby Amelia Island but did not want to pay island prices for lodging. This Holiday Inn was only 15 minutes away on a major road. The hotel is relatively new, had a nice breakfast/sitting room, outdoor pool and a tiny computer room wiht free internet (which was nice as I had not brought my laptop with me). The room was large and comfortable; we all had an excellent night's sleep. Breakfast was quite good and there was a nice variety to choose from. If my family ever goes back to Amelia Island, we would be sure to stay here again.
reviews.title: LOVE/HATE STAY

reviews.text: This is the third year we have stayed at this hotel and it remains a great place to stay. The hotel and pool are very clean, the staff is very nice and accommodating. I highly recommend this hotel! We will be back next year for sure.
reviews.title: Very clean, nice staff, we will be back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was so disgusted to have orange juice from the "Sunshine State" that was so watered down it looked like someone's pale urine. Weak terrible coffee. Same old thing everyday including stale baby muffins. No appeal at all that we went to the McDonald's each morning to have a real breakfast. At least we could have yogurt parfaits, hot oatmeal or egg McMuffins with real OJ and much better coffee.
reviews.title: Terrible breakfasts

reviews.text: Bedding very cheap. Doors to bathroom way oversized. No lids on toilets so towels or toiletries could easily fall inside. They did not change the cheap shower/hand soaps
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: each day. Beds very uncomfortable and pillows terrible. Stiff neck every day. Very
reviews.title: Awful customer service
Good place to stop on the way back from a trip!
reviews.text: unsatisfied. Will not return and thought someone should know in hopes that they might quit watering down the beverages.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here on the way to cocoa beach, fl for a cruise. Staff was pleasant but bed was hard as a rock and the next morning I awoke with terrible low back pain. Would not stay here again just for the beds. The hotel itself was clean and well kept and room was average.
reviews.title: A little below average stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A repeat stay for us, we are always pleased at the comfort and cleanliness of this Holiday nn Express. The mattresses may be in need of a little updating, however, because the previous night, in Emporia, VA, the bedding was superior. We would return here again in any event.
reviews.title: Consistently good

reviews.text: Breakfast bar is up to par!
reviews.title: Clean, quiet, good breakfast, good value

reviews.text: We pulled off the highway here late one night on the way home from Florida and the Holiday In Express was a pleasant overnight stay. Decor is pretty spartan but the staff is friendly and the rooms were clean, comfortable and quiet. Rooms had queen size beds, a nice surprise. Complimentary breakfast included scrambled eggs and patty sausage besides the usual juice, coffee and cereal. There is a fitness room and an outdoor pool, with pleasant wooded surroundings. It's not the Marriott but it is a good value.
reviews.title: Three times and still great!!

reviews.text: We had a pre beach stay here the last 3 years and it was perfect.
reviews.title: Nice for a quick trip
Disappointing Stay Because of Poor Maintenance
reviews.text: We stayed here once before without mishap, but last night we foundered twice on what was Caused by poor maintenance in the rooms. First, we were put in a room with a broken refrigerator that periodically made a loud low hum. A late night room change was necessitated. Then, in the second room, the TV didn't work and the desk clerk's efforts were to no avail. Too late to bother changing rooms a second time, however. Not what we expected from this facility. We asked the desk clerk for an adjustment to our bill for our troubles. Nada. Stupid decision. We won't be back here because there's many other facilities to choose from in the area.

Be careful when making reservations online because if you choose the lowest rate you are actually choosing the policy where you are not able to cancel for any reason without being charged for the first night! My child had lice and so I called 5 days prior to our check in to cancel and they were going to charge me anyway. They had no concern whether or not I was coming (with lice!) or not, they just wanted their money! In my opinion this is not good customer service for me or for any other guest staying in the room after me. I also had reservations at another hotel and they were very concerned and canceled with no charge. I will never stay at a Holiday Inn Express again for this one incident of bad customer service. That is not how you do business. There are plenty of other hotels!!!
reviews.title: Would not make another reservation here again!
Nice place to stay!
reviews.text: Stayed here two nights on our way to destination in Florida. Our room was very nice, clean, bed was comfortable and had comfortable seating besides the bed. The pool was clean as was the breakfast area, breakfast food was good with plenty of selection. Only negative was girl at check in counter was very interested in a television show, which she was engrossed in while checking us in. We also stayed here on our way back home as did our friends on our recommendation.

Hotel was very clean, front desk was very helpful and kind. The suite was clean, quite large, and the swimming pool was just the right size for the kids to play and have fun before bed. Breakfast was very good and the price was great.
reviews.title: Another great stay

reviews.text: I had to cancel my reservation, but did so weeks ahead of my stay and they still found it within thier hearts to charge me for one night and fill the room at a higher rate during a local event. Taking advantage of your customers is the fastest way to go out of business.
reviews.title: Would not recommend

aka: Holiday Inn Express Hotel And Suites Yulee
description: Guests planning a vacation in Amelia Island, Fernandina Beach, Kingsland (GA), or Jacksonville know that this hotel is the choice to make. This new Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites is conveniently located off I-95, just 10 miles north of Jacksonville and 10 miles south of Kingsland, GA. This hotel is within 10 miles to many area attractions including Fernandina Beach, Amelia Island, North Hampton Golf Course, Jacksonville International Airport (JAX) , Kings Bay Navel Submarine Base, Kingsland, GA. Upscale Amelia Island and Fernandina Beach offer unique boutiques with quaint restaurants and winding streets. The hotel is also close to a variety of restaurants, several golf courses, kayaking, and bicycle and boat rentals. Our new hotel features deluxe amenities like free complimentary high-speed Internet, free hot breakfast buffet, fitness center, business center, and 32 LCD TVs in the guest rooms. However, the best way to relax at our hotel is the large outdoor pool. We think you'll agree that our rooms offer more deluxe amenities for a better value. Remember Stay Smart stay at the Holiday Inn Express & Suites Jacksonville North - Fernandina.
